Title: Claude 3.7 Now Available in GitHub Copilot for Visual Studio
Author: Rhea Patel
EnhancedContent:
The world of AI is evolving at a breathtaking pace, and today brings an exciting milestone for developers and tech enthusiasts alike. Anthropic’s newest release, [**Claude 3.7**](https://www.anthropic.com/), is now available directly within GitHub Copilot for Visual Studio 2022 17.13, heralding a new era of seamlessly integrated, advanced AI coding assistance. This new Sonnet model supports the non-thinking modes in Copilot.

[![Image image](data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAaUAAADwAQMAAACaKOkdAAAAA1BMVEXW1taWrGEgAAAACXBIWXMAAA7EAAAOxAGVKw4bAAAAI0lEQVRoge3BMQEAAADCoPVPbQdvoAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAOA3MqAAAX7skIYAAAAASUVORK5CYII=)](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/visualstudio/wp-content/uploads/sites/4/2025/02/image.jpg)

### How to Access Claude 3.7

Getting started is easy:

- **Open the Chat Window:** Click the Copilot badge at the top right of your Visual Studio interface.
- **Launch Copilot Edit:** Open the chat window to initiate an editing session.
- **Select Your Model:** In the prompt box, open the model picker. By default, ChatGPT 4 is selected, but you can easily switch to Claude 3.7 Sonnet to harness its advanced features.

If you don’t see Claude 3.7 as an option, there could be two reasons:

1. **It’s not available for Copilot Free users.** Only paid Copilot users have access to this model.
2. **You need to enable the policy for 3.7 Sonnet in your GitHub profile.** Make sure to enable Claude access in your [setting](https://github.com/settings/copilot).

#### Learn More

For further details, check out the [Using Claude Sonnet in Copilot Chat – GitHub Docs.](https://docs.github.com/en/copilot/using-github-copilot/ai-models/using-claude-sonnet-in-github-copilot#about-claude-sonnet-in-github-copilot-chat)

We’re super excited about this enhancement to our development environment and can’t wait to hear your feedback. Let us know what you think!
